title: How to Make Dak Bokkeum Tang

steps.headline: Boil about 7 cups of water in a large pot over high heat.
Place the chicken drumsticks into the water and let them cook for 5-10 minutes.
steps.description: This helps eliminate the poultry smell of the chicken.

steps.headline: Once the drumsticks are fully cooked, carefully drain the hot water.
steps.description: If you're concerned about your chicken falling into the sink, then use a strainer.

steps.headline: Rinse the chicken under cold running water.
steps.description: Once the drumsticks are rinsed, place them on a plate to let them cool.

steps.headline: Add all of the sauce ingredients into a bowl.
steps.description: Once they are mixed, place the sauce aside.

steps.headline: Place the peeled and roughly chopped potatoes and carrots into a clean pot.
Place the fully cooked drumsticks on top of the potatoes and carrots.
Add the sauce on the top of the chicken along while also adding the same ratio of water as the sauce.
Cover the pot with a lid and cook it over high heat until the potatoes and carrots are halfway cooked.
Add the roughly chopped onions and let them cook for another 5 minutes over medium heat, without the lid.
Once the onions have cooked for 5 minutes, add the chopped green onions on top of the dish.
Serve.
steps.description: Enjoy this tasty dish while it's hot.

text: Boil about 7 cups of water in a large pot over high heat.  Place the chicken drumsticks into the water and let them cook for 5-10 minutes. This helps eliminate the poultry smell of the chicken. Once the drumsticks are fully cooked, carefully drain the hot water. If you're concerned about your chicken falling into the sink, then use a strainer. Rinse the chicken under cold running water. Once the drumsticks are rinsed, place them on a plate to let them cool. Add all of the sauce ingredients into a bowl. Once they are mixed, place the sauce aside. Place the peeled and roughly chopped potatoes and carrots into a clean pot.  Place the fully cooked drumsticks on top of the potatoes and carrots.  Add the sauce on the top of the chicken along while also adding the same ratio of water as the sauce.  Cover the pot with a lid and cook it over high heat until the potatoes and carrots are halfway cooked.  Add the roughly chopped onions and let them cook for another 5 minutes over medium heat, without the lid.  Once the onions have cooked for 5 minutes, add the chopped green onions on top of the dish.  Serve. Enjoy this tasty dish while it's hot.
